p: In our setting, the proportion of measles cases reported by hospital wards was unexpectedly high, although this was not necessarily related to the presence of clinical complications. In this regard, however, it must be stressed that hospitalized patients were significantly younger than the cases in the community [ 21– 23], most of them were children aged ≤5 years, and this may have potentially reflected a justifiable high-level attention in respect to this population group.
